lcSingleSelect.lcQuestion: DITA is an open standard, which means (choose one):

lcAnswerOption.lcAnswerContent: Anyone can use it without paying for it.
When updates are released, you must upgrade and pay or lose access to your information.
Updates are controlled by the International Standards Organization (ISO).

lcSingleSelect.lcFeedbackIncorrect: DITA is controlled by the Organization for the Advancement of Structured Information Standards (OASIS). Open standards are free.
